results.title: Maximize Superannuation Contributions
results.description: Contribute to superannuation funds to take advantage of tax concessions. Consider salary sacrificing up to the concessional cap ($27,500 for the 2023 financial year) to reduce taxable income.

results.title: Utilize Tax Offsets
results.description: Explore eligibility for tax offsets such as the Low and Middle Income Tax Offset (LMITO) to reduce tax liability.

results.title: Claim Work-Related Deductions
results.description: Ensure all work-related expenses are claimed, including home office expenses, travel costs, and professional development courses.

results.title: Invest in Tax-Effective Investments
results.description: Consider investing in negatively geared properties or shares to offset income with losses, reducing taxable income.

results.title: Utilize Family Trusts
results.description: Establish a family trust to distribute income among beneficiaries, potentially lowering the overall tax rate.

results.title: Consider Income Splitting
results.description: If one partner has a lower income, consider income splitting strategies to reduce the overall tax burden.

results.title: Prepay Expenses
results.description: Prepay certain expenses (e.g., insurance premiums) before the end of the financial year to bring forward deductions.

results.title: Invest in Tax-Advantaged Accounts
results.description: Utilize tax-advantaged accounts such as a Health Savings Account (HSA) for medical expenses, if applicable.

results.title: Review Investment Structures
results.description: Consider the tax implications of different investment structures (e.g., companies, partnerships) to optimize tax outcomes.

results.title: Engage in Charitable Giving
results.description: Make donations to registered charities to claim tax deductions while supporting causes they care about.
